title: Château Coudray Montpensier 2015 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)
description: This soft, juicy and fruity is full of red-berry flavors that are laced with acidity and a spicy, smoky edge. The wine is smooth and ready to drink.

title: Basel Cellars 2011 Estate Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Already a full five-years-old, this cool vintage wine brings aromas of freshly brewed coffee, baking spice, vanilla, green herb and tobacco. The flavors are light and elegant, showing a pretty styling but the concentration doesn't always seem fully there.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2013 Merlot (Paicines)
description: From a warmer region about 27 miles inland from Monterey Bay, this bottling shows crushed black rocks, black cherry, light vanilla and the slightest bit of char on the nose. It's relatively demure on the palate, with touches of milk chocolate, red cherry, gravel and graphite.

title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2013 Clos de Grands Voyens Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: The wine has tannins and a dry core that is fleshed out with red-berry fruits. At three-years-old it is already maturing with a rustic edge as well as spice and berry fruits. This is ready to drink.
designation: Clos de Grands Voyens Premier Cru

title: Famille Perrin 2014 L'Oustalet Red (Vin de France)
description: Made from certified organic grapes, this is a medium-bodied blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Merlot. Bay leaf and black olive aromas add earthy notes on the palate, giving this ripe, chocolaty wine an anchor in the south of France. Drink now.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2012 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)
description: This attractive, smoky wine has a soft, juicy texture that comes through the red fruits. Balanced and ripe, it finishes with acidity and is ready to drink.

title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2015 Closerie des Alisiers  (Bourgogne)
description: This is a fruity, juicy and soft wine. It has plenty of red-currants that give the wine a crisper side. It comes from a vineyard just north of the Burgundian capital of Dijon, which produces the wine's cool fruity character. Drink from 2017.

title: Marani 2014 Tsinandali White (Kakheti)
description: Pale straw to the eye, this wine offers a bouquet of lemon with a pleasant whiff of petrol. It is equal parts creamy and bright on the palate, with flavors of Granny Smith apple, apricot and lavender.

title: Mocali 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This straightforward Sangiovese opens with aromas of purple flower, woodland berry and a whiff of truffle. The bright, earthy palate offers tart cherry, cranberry, a hint of anise and a gamey note alongside zesty acidity.

title: Morgan 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Ripe aromas of peach, nectarine and yellow pear meet with a hint of flint on the nose of this exuberant, well-priced and appealing bottling. Stone-fruit flavors show on the palate, with apple, pear and ripe lemon touches cut by dried grass. It's easy to quaff on a warm day.

title: Jones of Washington 2012 Barrel Select Estate Vineyards Red (Wahluke Slope)
description: Vanilla, black plum, blackberry and dark cherry aromas are followed by appealing sour-cherry flavors that show a sense of softness.

title: Maryhill 2012 Proprietor's Reserve Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of fruit from Gunkel and Elephant Mountain vineyards, this wine offers light aromas of cherry and toasty barrel spice. The flavors are elegant, tart and juicy, with cocoa flavors lingering on the finish.

title: Maryhill 2013 Klipsun Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: The oak (50% new French wood) seems a bit heavy handed, interjecting scents of wood, coffee and vanilla on the aromas and flavors. It's a shame as the cranberry flavors otherwise provide interest.

title: Maryhill 2013 Les Collines Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from one of the state's premier Syrah sites, this wine offers aromas of barrel spice and herb, with the volatiles amped up. The cherry flavors show restraint while tapering toward the finish.

title: Maryhill 2013 Northridge Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)
description: The aromas offer notes of cherry, baking and barrel spices and are topped off with partially amped-up volatiles. The flavors are lush and full bodied, lingering on the finish.

title: Glenora 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Lifted floral and blackberry notes perfume this delicately textured Cabernet Franc. It's lighter and leaner in style than many 2014 Finger Lakes reds but still concentrated in flavor. Bright acidity, fine tannins and a swathe of rustic herbs and bramble extend on the finish.

title: J.R. Dill 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Seneca Lake)
description: Fleshy, sun-ripened black plum and currant flavors are rounded and rich in this elegant, slightly Old World Cabernet Sauvignon. It's squarely concentrated in fruit flavor but veins of crushed mineral and dried herb add gravitas. It's brisk in body with a cool, cutting finish. Drink now through 2021.

title: Jamesport 2013 Estate Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Intensely ripe and ruddy black cherry and berry flavors seem spiced with cocoa powder and cinnamon in this approachable juicy wine. Bright acidity lends freshness to the midpalate. The finish is cushioned by soft feathery tannins and lingering hints of sweet spice.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Blend Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: Both refreshing and nicely fruity, this wine blends bright apple and lemon flavors on a tangy texture that softens a bit on the finish.

title: Rutini 2015 Trumpeter Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Dark dense tarry aromas of blackberry and cassis are a touch stewy and flat. This feels wide and grabby, with grapy flavors of blackberry and plum. A jammy feeling finish with berry flavors has a dark and toasty side to it.

title: Skyfall 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of plum, chocolate, wood spice and smoke lead to sweet, medium-bodied fruit flavors. The tannins come off as somewhat dry.

title: Smoking Loon 2015 Steelbird Unoaked Chardonnay Chardonnay (California)
description: Crisp and tangy, this smells citrusy and tastes like green apples and light herbs. It feels lively, has good balance and a refreshing finish.

title: Lone Birch 2015 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of red apple and spice lead to rounded fruit flavors that provide easy-drinking appeal. It's a well-priced spot-on example of the variety.

title: Mumm Napa 2011 Devaux Ranch Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir grapes, this marks the first offering of this rosé from this ranch in the heart of Carneros. Dry and simple in approach, it delivers a crispness of lemon, lime and strawberry, becoming rich on the palate as it lingers.

title: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown, Produced & Bottled Muscat Canelli (Sierra Foothills)
description: Aromas like honeydew melon and flavors recalling sweet cucumber create a very fruity profile for this medium-bodied, lightly sweet wine.

title: Pisano 2013 Río de los Pájaros Reserve Tannat (Progreso)
description: Plum and currant aromas that have a minty and herbal feel precede a raw tight tannic palate that's fresh and lively but tough. Peppery blackberry and plum flavors finish with hard tannins as well as modest heat and burn.

title: Punta del Cielo 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Rough piercing aromas of tomato and herbs outweigh berry scents. This feels rugged and bumpy, with hard tannins. Generic berry flavors come with a hint of cinnamon and spice, while this reverts to being rough and abrasive on the finish.

title: Q & A NV Red (California)
description: Fresh, fruity and just a touch sweet, this lighter-bodied wine is easy to drink, refreshing and smooth. The aromas and flavors are full of red cherries and raspberries.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Buissonnier  (Montagny)
description: Montagny is at the southern end of the Côte Chalonnaise before it merges into Mâcon. That gives this wine its warmth and ripe apple and peach fruits. It is crisp and fresh at the same time with great juicy acidity. The wine has a spicy aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Villa I Cipressi 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Aromas of truffle, tilled soil, dark berry and a whiff of blue flower lead the nose on this easygoing red. The lithe palate delivers dark cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside supple tannins and bright acidity.
